dialogues.text: Fade in-- On the Matrix at code level, where we are traveling with speed of thought-- Rushing through streaks of coded light before pausing to survey an area from above, aS a god might. We glide down for a slightly closer look at the encoded metropolis, effortlessly moving through the walls and roo of a skyscraper, until we again accelerate beyond the spe of light to search--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the code forms the familiar drips and we pull out onto monitors of the Mjolnir’s operator’s station. AK, Link’s counterpart on this ship, beats his keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: AK
dialogues.text: I got nothing, sir. No sign of Niobe or Ghost. Nothing but blue pills. The crew of the Mjolnir are gathered on the main deck.

dialogues.speaker: MAUSER
dialogues.text: Should we jack in and try to contact them?

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: It won't matter. My gut says they’re down.

dialogues.speaker: MAUSER
dialogues.text: Then we should start back?

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: No. If that ship can still fly, we need it.

dialogues.speaker: MAUSER
dialogues.text: I was afraid you were going to say that.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Search every pipe, every hole, every crack we know. Sweep as wide as possible, as fast as possible.

dialogues.speaker: AK
dialogues.text: Captain, these lines are crawling with calamari.  502 503 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 2. 502

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Then the sooner we find them the better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neo lies unconscious. Trinity is at his bedside. The door opens and Maggie, the ship’s medic, enters with small plate of food.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Thought you could use something to eat.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: Thank you. Trinity takes the plate from her.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Any change? She shakes her head. Maggie starts to check Neo’s monitors when Bane groans. S steps over to his bed which is a reverse of Neo’s positio

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: How is he?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: He’s going to be fine. At least until he wakes up.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: The Captain has some questions for him and he better have some good answers. Bane becomes silent and still.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You see these cuts on his body? Trinity nods.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I think they’re self inflicted.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: vDT's maybe. I don’t know. But, like I said, the answer better be good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morpheus and Link have remained at the perimeter of the meeting. Now Morpheus steps out of the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: MORPHEUS
dialogues.text: Roland.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: MORPHEUS
dialogues.text: I would like to run one more search through the Matrix.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: MORPHEUS
dialogues.text: For Neo.

dialogues.speaker: AK
dialogues.text: How could he be in the Matrix, sir? He’s not plugged in.

dialogues.speaker: MORPHEUS
dialogues.text: Please, for me. 505 INT. MJOLNIR - INFIRMARY — NIGHT Maggie re-reads Neo’s life monitors.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: This ig what keeps bothering me. Trinity rises to see the display.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: His neural patterns don’t read like someone who’s in a coma. The strange thing is that I see these patterns all the time.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: Where? 503 504 505  GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 4.
e@ MAGGIE On someone jacked in.

dialogues.text: 7 The Matrix drips down the window of the monitor.

dialogues.text: : The big bubkis. Nada, sir. He ain’t in * there. + Morpheus stares at the monitor not willing to accept it

dialogues.text: : Colt slides down the ladder from the cockpit. be COLT : Sir, I’ve got the projections.

dialogues.text: Le How long?

dialogues.text: 4 Based on point of entry and their past Le speed, it looks like the Machines will reach Zion in just under twenty hours.

dialogues.text: e Mauser, I want forward and aft guns * manned at all times. Suddenly Link notices something.

dialogues.speaker: LINK
dialogues.text: Hey...

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Make sure we’re running on as few pads as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 506 507 508 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 5. 506

dialogues.speaker: LINK
dialogues.text: Hey. Hey! Everyone stops and looks.

dialogues.speaker: LINK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You got a call.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: What? Link jumps into the seat, throwing on the headsets.

dialogues.speaker: LINK
dialogues.text: Operator.

dialogues.speaker: SERAPH, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: This is Seraph. I must speak to Morpheus. Link hands Morpheus the headset.

dialogues.speaker: LINK
dialogues.text: It’s Seraph. He wants to talk to you. EXT. CHINATOWN - PHONE BOOTH — NIGHT 507 Seraph is in a phone booth.

dialogues.speaker: SERAPH
dialogues.text: I bring word from the Oracle. She knows what has happened to Neo. You must come at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neo slowly, painfully, wakes up. His face is mashed against a grey concrete slab. Every pa of him hurts. A hot-wire migraine sears through both hemispheres of his brain. He peels open his eyes and sees a tiny pair of shoes. Into the glare of fluorescent light, he looks up at a beautiful little Indian girl. She smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: INDIAN GIRL
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 508 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 6. 508 For a moment he sees her as a program of pure radiant ene Bathed in the shimmering aura of her light he feels his p melting away.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: .-who are you?

dialogues.speaker: SATI
dialogues.text: My name is Sati. Your name is Neo. My Papa says that you are not supposed to be here. He says you must be lost. Are you lost, Neo?

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: Where am I?

dialogues.speaker: SATI
dialogues.text: This is the train station.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: The what? He pushes himself up to look around. The ceramic tiles ha been painted with the name of the station; Mobil Ave.

dialogues.speaker: NEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This isn’t the Matrix?

dialogues.speaker: SATI
dialogues.text: That's where the train goes. That's where we're going. But you can’t go with us.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: SATI
dialogues.text: He won’t let you.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: Who won't?

dialogues.speaker: SATI
dialogues.text: The Trainman. I don’t like him. But Papa says we have to do what the Trainman says or else he’ll leave us here. She whispers as if afraid the Trainman was listening.

dialogues.speaker: SATI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Porever and ever.  509 510 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seraph leads Morpheus and Trinity into the Oracle’s old apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morpheus and Trinity enter the old apartment. An Older Wo sits alone in the church-like silence.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Morpheus. Trinity. Thank you for coming. They look at one another, unable to recognize this woman. The Older Woman sighs.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One thing I've learned in all my years is that nothing ever works out just the way you want it to.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: I’m the Oracle. Neither believes it.

dialogues.speaker: ORACLE
dialogues.text: I wish there was an easy way to get through this but there ain’t. I’m sorry this had to happen. I’m sorry I couldn't be sitting here like you remember me. But it wasn’t meant to be.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: ORACLE
dialogues.text: I made a choice and that choice cost me more than I wanted it to.

dialogues.speaker: MORPHEUS
dialogues.text: What choice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 510 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 7A. 510

dialogues.speaker: ORACLE
dialogues.text: To help you. To guide Neo. Now, since the real test for any choice is having to make the same choice again, knowing full well what it might cost, I guess I feel pretty good about that choice ‘cause here Iam, at it again.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: You know what happened to Neo?

dialogues.speaker: ORACLE
dialogues.text: Yes. He is trapped in a place between this world and the Machine World. There are links that have been constructed like islands, used for trafficking information. Somehow Neo washed up onto one of them. The only way to rejoin his mind and body is to bring him back out through this world.  GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 8. 510

dialogues.speaker: PRINITY
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: ORACLE
dialogues.text: It won't be easy. The link is controlled by a program called the Trainman. He uses it to smuggle programs in and out of the Matrix. If he finds out where Neo is before you get to him, then I'm afraid our choices are going to become difficult.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: ORACLE
dialogues.text: Because of who the Trainman works for.

dialogues.speaker: MORPHEUS
dialogues.text: The Merovingian.

dialogues.speaker: ORACLE
dialogues.text: He has placed a bounty on your lives. You must be careful at all times. Seraph knows how to find the Trainman. He’ll go with you. For years he has protected me. I hope he can do the same for you.

dialogues.speaker: SERAPH
dialogues.text: Please follow me. Morpheus remains unsure, unable to step neither forward o backward.

dialogues.speaker: MORPHEUS
dialogues.text: Oracle...

dialogues.speaker: ORACLE
dialogues.text: I know, Morpheus. I can see you are filled with doubt, clouded by uncertainty.

dialogues.speaker: MORPHEUS
dialogues.text: After all that has happened, how can you expect me to believe you?

dialogues.speaker: ORACLE
dialogues.text: I don’t. I expect just what I’ve always expected: For you to make up your own damn mind. Believe me, or don’t.  510

dialogues.speaker: GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27,
dialogues.text: All I can do is tell you that your friend is in trouble and he needs your help. 2002 BA. 510  510 5il

dialogues.speaker: GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27,
dialogues.text: She turns to Trinity.

dialogues.speaker: ORACLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He needs all our help.
510 Sil Neo sits rubbing his temples, trying to piece together wh happened.

dialogues.speaker: SATI
dialogues.text: Are you from the Matrix?

dialogues.speaker: NEG
dialogues.text: Yes, no. IT mean, I was.

dialogues.speaker: SATI
dialogues.text: Why did you leave?

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: I had to.

dialogues.speaker: SATI
dialogues.text: I had to leave my home too.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Sati! Come here. Leave the poor man in peace.

dialogues.speaker: SATI
dialogues.text: Yes Papa. She runs to a middle-aged Indian man who is sitting on a bench beside his beautiful wife. Several suitcases stand line next to the bench.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: I am sorry. She is still very curious. Neo recognizes the man.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: I know you. He smiles.  GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 10. 51l 511

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: @ Yes. In the restaurant of the Frenchman. He stands.

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: } I am Rama-Kandra. This is my wife Kamala. * My daughter Sati. We are most honored to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: Hello. f RAMA We have heard much about you. Where we , come from you are called “the one that is expected.”

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: You’re programs. i

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Oh yes. I am the Power Plant systems manager for recycling operations. My wife is an interactive software programmer. She is highly creative.

dialogues.speaker: KAMALA
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? You do not belong here.

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Kamala. Goodness I apologize. My wife can be very direct.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: It's okay. I don’t have an answer. I don’t even know where “here” is.

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: This place is nowhere. It is between your world and our world.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: How do you get out of here?

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: There is only one way. The train.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: Who is the Trainman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 521 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 11. Bil

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: He works for the Frenchman.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: Why did I know you were going to say that.

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: The Frenchman does not forget and he does not forgive.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: You know him?

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: I know only what I need to know. I know that if you want to take something from our world into your world that does not belong there, you must go to the Frenchman.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: Is that what you are doing here?

dialogues.speaker: KAMALA
dialogues.text: Rama, please!

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: I de not want to be cruel, Kamala. He may never see another face for the rest of his life.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. You don’t have to answer that.

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: No. I don’t mind. The answer is simple. He lays his hand on Sati’s head.

dialogues.speaker: RAMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I love my daughter very much. I find her to be the most beautiful thing I have ever seen. But where we are from, that is not enough. Every program that is created must have a purpose. If it does not, it is deleted. Kamala looks away.

dialogues.speaker: RAMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I went to the Frenchman to save my daughter.  Sil

dialogues.speaker: GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 12.
dialogues.text: Sil Neo struggles with the idea of a Machine loving another Machine.

dialogues.speaker: RAMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You do not understand?

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: I just have never...

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Heard a program speak of love?

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: It is a human emotion.

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: No, it is a word. What matters is the connection the word implies. He reads Neo’s code.

dialogues.speaker: RAMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I see that you are in love. Neo feels awkwardly exposed.

dialogues.speaker: RAMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can you tell me what you would give to hold on to that connection?

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: .. anything. Rama smiles.

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Then perhaps the reason you are here is not so different than the reason I am here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wild-eyed derelict sits in the front car of a subway tr The train clatters and screeches down the urban throat wh fluorescent lights hang like broken teeth, glowing agains the darkness. It is late at night and the train is virtua empty. The rear door is shoved open with a sudden rush of wind a noise. The derelict turns and sees Seraph leading Morpheu and Trinity inte the car.  512 513 514 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 13. 512 The wild eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: SERAPH
dialogues.text: That's him. The Trainman leaps up, the burnished blue metal of a .38 special flashing free from his layers of clothes.

dialogues.speaker: TRAINMAN
dialogues.text: Get away! Get away from me! The few passengers react, while Seraph continues calmly toward him.

dialogues.speaker: SERAPH
dialogues.text: Please. We don’t want trouble.

dialogues.speaker: TRAINMAN
dialogues.text: Get away the hell away from me!

dialogues.speaker: SERAPH
dialogues.text: We need your help.

dialogues.speaker: TRAINMAN
dialogues.text: I can’t help you! No one can help you! The train passes through a station and the Trainman yanks emergency lever-- Throwing the train into a lurching stop. He dives out the open door. Seraph, Morpheus and Trinity lunge after him. INT. SUBWAY STATION ONE ~ PLATFORM A — NIGHT 5h Like a panicked antelope that breaks from the pack, directionless, bolting with a kind of awkward grace--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bounds up the stairwell, and zig-zags through the most deserted tunnels that lead up to inter-connecting station Checking a wrist full of watches, he veers off towards another staircase. Almost flying he hurls himself down th stairs to the train platform below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and fires at the three pursuing figures.  515 516 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 14. 515 Weaving behind the steel and concrete columns, he continu to fire forcing them to take cover until-—- The station begins to rumble and the Trainman smiles. He whirls out from his column firing, emptying the gun, waiting for the train to blast into the station. Seraph sees the train that is not going to stop and reali what the Trainman is about to do.

dialogues.speaker: SERAPH
dialogues.text: Oh no. He spins out into the line of fire, bullets burying in pillars with plumes of concrete colored dust. The Trainman turns, sprinting towards the train tracks an jumps. For a flashing instant, a perfect silhouette in th blaring train-light, his wild clothes like the broken win of a bat as~- He leaps from one platform to another disappearing behind rushing train. And when it finally passes, he is gone, leaving the three alone in the silence that slowly swallows the dopplering train.

dialogues.speaker: MORPHEUS
dialogues.text: Damnit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rama is looking at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: NEC
dialogues.text: When is the train due?

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: It is already late. It is not like the Trainman to be late. He eyes Neo for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: You think it has something to do with me?

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Iocan not say. Who knows such things? Only the Oracle.  516 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 15. 516

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: You know the Oracle?

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Everyone knows the Oracle. I consulted with her before I met with the Frenchman. She promised she would look after Sati after we said goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: Goodbye? You're not staying with her?

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: It is not possible. Our arrangement with the Frenchman was for our daughter only. My wife and I must return to our world.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: why?

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: That is our karma.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: You believe in karma?

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Karma is a word, like love. A way of saying what I am here to do. He looks at his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: RAMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I do not resent my karma. I am grateful for it. Grateful for my wonderful wife. For my beautiful daughter. They are gifts and so I do what I must de to honor them. The station begins to rumble.

dialogues.speaker: SATL
dialogues.text: Papa, the train!

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Yes. Find your bag. Quickly.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: Can I carry that for you? Rama pauses.

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 516 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 16. 516 He hands Neo one of the bags. The train is only one car long. It screams to a stop and doors clamber open. The Trainman steps out.

dialogues.speaker: TRAINMAN
dialogues.text: Hurry it up! I’m late! They start to get on board, but suddenly the Trainman gra Neo.

dialogues.speaker: TRAINMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who are you?!

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: He is a friend.

dialogues.speaker: KAMALA
dialogues.text: Ramat

dialogues.speaker: TRAINMAN
dialogues.text: Wait...wait... I know you. His eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: TRAINMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's why they were-- His smile is yellow and crooked.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: I need to get back. He starts to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: NEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll pay whatever you want. The joke gets better.

dialogues.speaker: NEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One way or another I’m getting on this train.

dialogues.speaker: TRAINMAN
dialogues.text: Oh no, no, no. You’re going to stay right here until the Merovingian says different and if I know him, you're going to be here for a long, long time.  516 517 518 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 17. 516

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: I don’t want to hurt you. The curl of his lips is more like a scythe than a smile.

dialogues.speaker: TRAINMAN
dialogues.text: You don’t get it. I built this place. Down here, I make the rules. Down here, I make the threats. He hits Neo and sends him flying, smashing into the ceram and concrete wall.

dialogues.speaker: TRAINMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Down here, I’m God. He scowls at Rama and his family.

dialogues.speaker: TRAINMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get on the train or you stay here with him. Rama drops his eyes and gets on the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seraph is driving the big Lincoln. Trinity stares out the window alone in the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: SERAPH
dialogues.text: We should return to the Oracle. She will know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: No. Morpheus turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We know what has to be done. Morpheus can see the answer reflected in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MORPHEUS
dialogues.text: The Merovingian.

dialogues.speaker: INT, MOBIL AVE. STATION
dialogues.text: Cradiing his broken ribs, Neo jumps down onto the tracks. They disappear into darkness. He starts running in the sa direction as the train went.

dialogues.text: 518 519 GOLDENRCD REVISIOKS JUNE 27, 2002 18. we watch for a moment, then pan back to look in the oppos direction where we see him now running towards us. He stops as he enters the station: “Mobil Ave.” He looks the way he came. He runs that way only to end up exactly where he started.

dialogues.text: Shit. INT. UNDERGROUND GARAGE - NIGHT £19 A corral of exquisite cars and limousines are parked near single metal door. dialogues.text: To the eye, she igs a flash, almost a ghost as she spins a coll and then Launches herself into the aiz--  519 520 521 522 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 19. 519 Rising in Bullet Time, bullets chasing her in the fanning of a ticking second hand until-~ A savage kick bounces the huge man against the steel door back into Trinity who slices him with the precision of a sushi-master, dropping him to the floor. Before the other two can react, Seraph and Morpheus attac leaping out from behind the nearest vehicles-- Catching the killers off balance as they deliver their bl with lethal fury. It is over quickly, three dark heaps laying crumpled in t pool of white light. Without hesitation, Trinity opens the metal door. Seraph Morpheus follow.

dialogues.text: There are only two buttons. The lower button is slightly with the word, “hel” written on it.

She stabs the cigarette out.

dialogues.text: smith. She nods.

dialogues.text: I suppose you’ve been expecting me right? The all-knowing Oracle is never surprised. How can she be? She knows everything. But if that’s true, then why is she here? If she knew I was coming, why wouldn't she leave? He suddenly grabs the plate of cookies and hurls it, smas it against the wail. She doesn’t flinch.

dialogues.text: Maybe you knew I was going to do that. Maybe you didn’t. She is the Sphinx.

The moment he does, we see an explosion of light and ener as the lines of code that make up the entire room break apart, code flying frantically, caught in the violent win of a digital tornado. The kitchen-in-itself looks as if a cyclone were tearing apart as the Smiths gathered at the door, glance about li nervous chickens. The wind dies, the kitchen now destroyed and sitting wher the Oracle was, is another Smith. He stands, dizzy, overwhelmed by the experience. The othe Smith steps away from him. The Oracle/Smith removes his sunglasses as he looks for a moment beyond the room, beyond the code. For a moment he looks into the future. And what he sees, makes him laugh.

dialogues.text: Has this man been tested for VDT’s?

dialogues.text: Yes sir. It was negative, but he is showing a lot of unusual neural activity. Some cross synaptic firing, as well as signs of recent trauma with fresh fibrotic scarring throughout the cortex. Bane continues to stare at the scabbing cut. Frustrated, Roland gets up, whispering to Maggie.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: T want the truth. I don’t care what it takes. Make him remember. She nods.

A dark scorched plane of e marked by the three black lines that pull us closer and closer until-- He blinks and the image is gone.  GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 41.

Link hurries out with a lightning gun, trying to guard Morpheus. They pass one of the dead Sentinels. Cautiousiy, Link steps over to it and kicks it when there a loud bang.

dialogues.text: Niobe. He seems, For a moment, caught between what he should do what he wants to do.

dialogues.text: What? Yes, = just-~ We weren't sure what happened after, and I... I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: NIOBE
dialogues.text: The same thing she always does. Exactly what I needed to hear. She heads off for the ramp. (‘553° INT. ZION ~ COUNCIL CHAMBERS - DAY 553 Lock addresses the council.  553 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 44. 553

dialogues.speaker: LOCK
dialogues.text: In less than twelve hours the Machines will breach the dock walls. In every simulation we’ve run, we’ve seen that once the Machines are inside the city, the odds of our survival decrease dramatically. The room is crowded but quiet, everyone intently followin the Logic of Lock.

dialogues.speaker: LOCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thus cur primary objective must be to destroy or disable the diggers inside the dock. If we can do that, perhaps we can prevent them from ever reaching the city. He speaks like a coroner, describing a cause of death, precise and without emotion.

dialogues.speaker: LOCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If not, then the only place we will be able to mount an effective defense will be at the entrance of the Temple. It is small enough that it will force them into a bottleneck allowing us to concentrate the remainder of our defense.

dialogues.speaker: TUCHMAN
dialogues.text: Commander, what’s to stop the Machines from tunneling straight into the Temple?

dialogues.speaker: LOCK
dialogues.text: It appears to us that the diggers are targeting the electrical activity of Zion. I don’t think they are even aware that the Temple exists.

dialogues.speaker: DILLARD
dialogues.text: We understand that you have requested additional volunteers.

dialogues.speaker: LOCK
dialogues.text: That is correct.

dialogues.speaker: WEST
dialogues.text: Precisely what size force are you planning to commit to the primary dock objective.

dialogues.speaker: LOCK
dialogues.text: Right now, the entire APU Corps and half the infantry.

dialogues.speaker: WEST
dialogues.text: Half the infantry?

dialogues.speaker: LOCK
dialogues.text: If it were up to me, councillor I’d take every man, woman and child, put a gun in their hand and march them straight into that dock.

dialogues.speaker: DILLARD
dialogues.text: Perhaps it is best that it is not up to you.

dialogues.speaker: LOCK
dialogues.text: Time will tell, councillor.

dialogues.speaker: HAMMAN
dialogues.text: Commander, just one more question. Has there been word of the Nebuchadnezzar?

dialogues.speaker: LOCK
dialogues.text: None and at this point there is no reason to expect there ever will be.

dialogues.speaker: HAMMAN
dialogues.text: No Commander, but we can hope.

dialogues.speaker: LOCK
dialogues.text: I'm afraid hope is an indulgence I don’t have time for,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The catwalks and platforms are alive with activity, its inhabitants preparing for the impending siege. un an un

dialogues.text: Zee is alone folding a powdery mixture in a large teflon bowl. The table is strewn with strange tools as if she we baking a cake or fixing an engine. She sets the bowl next to a set of scales, looking up as enters, carrying several bags. The children are behind he

dialogues.text: cas They’re evacuating our level. We have to go.

dialogues.text: Maybe it is, but ask yourself, if it was Dozer and you knew the only chance you had to see him again was to hold that dock, what would you do? She looks down considering what she would do to have Doze alive again. There is only one answer to the question.

dialogues.speaker: CAS
dialogues.text: «--Make shelis. Zee hugs her.  GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 47.

The front wheel bumps over a tangle o power lines and the kid loses control, tumbling forward a the bin tips over. The boxes smash open with the bright metal chatter of end strings of bullets spilling out around the kid.

dialogues.text: What the shit is going on over there?

dialogues.text: What‘s a pod-born pencil-neck like you doing volunteering for my Corps?

dialogues.text: I want to do my part, sir. We have to hold the dock.

dialogues.text: You should have said sixteen. I might have believed that.

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: Okay. I’m sixteen.

dialogues.text: Minimum age for the Corps is eighteen. Sixteen is too young.

dialogues.text: wn a me

dialogues.text: Now what? INT. MUJOLNIR - MESS HALT ~- DAY £6 The Captains and Seconds of each ship are gathered around table.

dialogues.text: The Machines have taken Junction Twenty- one. The way I see it, if we drop down from broadcast here, intersect One~- seventy, we might surprise them. There is an intricate map of the sewer lines spread out o the table.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We'll go first, hammer as deep as we can, then blow our EMP. Hopefully we can punch a hole big enough for you to get through. He leans back.

dialogues.text: There's another way. A support line. It drops dowr right here, at least a thousand meters short of Twenty-one. If we're lucky, we may be able to slip down without them ever knowing.

® MORPHEUS That was a long time ago, Niobe and nowhere near this long a run.

dialogues.text: i said I can do it.

dialogues.text: Bullshit! IT am the Captain of this ship. I say where it has to go. And believe me, this ship will go to hell long before I let you take it anywhere.

dialogues.text: You can’t do that——  562 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 2. 562

dialogues.text: Don’t even think about teliing me what I can and can’t do with my ship after that little speech.

dialogues.text: I stili don’t.

dialogues.text: Because I believe in him. Neo isn’t sure how to respond.

dialogues.text: What’s that for?

dialogues.text: To help you relax. To make it easier for you to remember.

dialogues.text: What if I blew that EMP? What if I did destroy those ships and I am responsible for the deaths of all those men?  un a

dialogues.text: Tf I did that, then it wouldn‘t be very safe for me here, would it? He smiles. Maggie sees something behind his eyes that frightens her. 54. 565 She tries to stab him with the needle, but he’s ready for He catches her and leaps off the table, driving her back against the wall. With snake-bite speed, he whips a hidden scalpel from his sleeve and jams it into her heart.

dialogues.text: Of course, it might not be very safe for you either.

dialogues.text: There's something I have to say. Something you need to understand... She waits.

dialogues.speaker: NEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know I’m supposed to go, but beyond that... I don’t know... I’m not sure if... He is unable to find the words, so she does.

dialogues.text: I knew it the moment you said you had to leave. 566

dialogues.text: IT saw it in your face, just like you knew the moment you looked at me, that I was coming with you.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: T’m seared, Trin. She drops her bag and steps close to him.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: So am I. It took me ten minutes to buckle up one boot. But I'll tell you something Neo, six hours ago I told the Merovingian I was ready to give anything and everything for you. He believed me. Do you know what’s changed in the last six hours?

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: Nothing. She kisses him and in the kiss there is a vow.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND, (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: iu ER A Ss OR USAT

dialogues.text: Ready? He looks out as the lights from the Mjolnir disappear aro the corner of intersecting pipe. He nods. She takes hold of the stick when suddenly the lights in t cockpit die. Checking several gauges, she listens to the ship’s engine.

dialogues.text: The hatch slaps open and Trinity climbs down the ladder, fluorescent torch the only source of light. The room looks like a dozen old basements were crammed in crawl-space. Trinity searches the fuse boxes that line th walls and finds a series of disconnected fuses when-—

dialogues.text: Bane attacks. Her light clatters to the floor as he grabs her from behi pressing the scalpel against her throat.

dialogues.text: I should have known he'd send his bitch first.

dialogues.text: Bane?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 575 576 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 58. 574 He digs the blade up under her jawbone, forcing her head back.

dialogues.speaker: BANE
dialogues.text: No one ever got away from me as many times as you did. Every single time T thought it was the last, every time I was sure we had you, somehow you'd slip through our fingers. I really can’t express just how aggravating that can be.

dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

She grabs the knife hand, fighting it with all her streng as she screams throwing them both backward crashing to th floor. The two bodies writhe and twist, knotting and unknotting until Trinity slips free-- Grabbing the light as he grabs her. Twisting back, she smashes it into his face, pitching the voom into darkness except for the light that falls throug the hatch. She lunges for the ladder, scrambling up it as a shadow l after her.

dialogues.text: Neo! It’s Bane! He‘’s psychotic! She’s cut off, shooting Neo from his seat.

Pain explodes through her body, black spots bursting in h vision. Bane wipes the back of his hand across his shattered nose

dialogues.text: Yes. Luckily. Some things do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 690 In the silence, a door falls from its hinges along the sh back, the crew of the Mjolnir climbing out. As Colt helps Roland from the opening, Link staggers past them onto the dock floor.

dialogues.speaker: ZEE
dialogues.text: Link!

dialogues.speaker: LINK
dialogues.text: Zee! They push through the soldiers gathered on the catwalks surrounding the crashed ship, until they fall into each other’s arms.

dialogues.speaker: ZEE
dialogues.text: I knew you'd come. Somehow... I knew you would.

dialogues.speaker: LINK
dialogues.text: I promised. He kisses her and she sees the charm hanging around his n  6390 691 692 693 694 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 96. 690

dialogues.speaker: ZEE
dialogues.text: You did wear it.

dialogues.speaker: LINK
dialogues.text: You kidding? I’m never gonna take it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Logos banks along a pipe thick with steam that is breathed from a series of openings caked with human greas and machine rust, like a scab that continues to leak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trinity feels the cold wind whistling down the throat of pipe. Neo’s eyes are bandaged with gauze.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: Temperature’s dropping. She weaves the ship into a worm hole through the debris u she can see the dim light streaming into the opening.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here we go. The opening appears to have been made by an earthquake; t pipeline cracked and separated, one side wrenched from th other. The ship shoots into the deep jagged fissure before banki straight up, revealing-- The surface of the Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fetus fields run right up to the edge of the ravine. pickers continue their work like grazing animals, oblivio to the Logos. The sky is a churning black sludge, its clotted clouds fr and leak a pale yellow light, casting a glow that is the color of dead callowed flesh. In the distance, the mile high towers of the Power Plant visible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neo stares out, as if able to see where they are.  694 695 696 697 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 97. 694

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: We're over the fields, aren’t we?

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: How did you know that?

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: I can...feel them. We move closer to him and we suddenly glimpse the fields he does--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A night sky filled with stars, though pressed flat as if a circuit board, wired into the distant towers that vibra with violent flashing light.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: Over there. He points out across the charred desert that surrounds th fields.

dialogues.speaker: NEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There’s our path. Can you see it? Three lines. Three enormous cables, each several hundred feet thick sn from the Power Plant out across the scorched earth.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: The power lines.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: Follow them. She swallows down her fear and steers the ship along the of the giant umbilicus. INT. ZION — COMMAND LEVEL ELEVATOR - NIGHT 697 The elevator bangs down and the metal gate ratchets open Morpheus, Roland and Niobe get out. Lock is waiting for them.

dialogues.speaker: LOCK
dialogues.text: Three Captains. One ship. I’1ll assume the other ships were lost under equally pointless circumstances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 697 698 699 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 98. 697

dialogues.speaker: NIOBE
dialogues.text: It's good to see you too, Jason.

dialogues.speaker: LOCK
dialogues.text: The council is waiting to hear your explanation. You’ll forgive me for not attending, but I have to try to salvage this debacle.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Did I miss something, Commander? I thought we just saved the dock.

dialogues.speaker: LOCK
dialogues.text: That’s the problem with you people. You can’t think but five minutes in front of your face. That EMP knocked out almost every piece of hardware and every APU. If Iowere the Machines, I’d send every Sentinel I had here right now. Saved the dock, Captain? You just handed it to them on a silver platter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soldiers are scrambling to unload the ammunition from the Mjolnir,. It is the kid that hears them first.

dialogues.speaker: COLT
dialogues.text: Come on kid. Let’s move it!

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: You hear that? He turns with the kid towards the rent gate. After a mome he hears it; the sound of air being forced out through a pipe, like a distant trumpet or a scream heard from far a

dialogues.speaker: COLT
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock's Second Operator is lugging a heavy battery powered radio.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Commander! It's the dock. They got incoming.

dialogues.speaker: TOL
dialogues.text: 702 703 704 705 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 99. 699

dialogues.speaker: LOCK
dialogues.text: Order everyone to fall back. Seal the shaft. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're already running for the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Fall back! Move it! Move it! The wind that signaled the first onslaught of the Sentine is nothing compared to the howl that rises to fill the en dock. The elevator is packed with the last batch of soldiers wh slowly lower into the shaft as-—- The Sentinel army pours into the concrete concourse from every hole, spilling into the empty dock like sand. coLtT Mother-~

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Second Operator receives the call.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND OPERATOR
dialogues.text: All clear!

dialogues.speaker: LOCK
dialogues.text: Do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lever is thrown inside a barricaded bunker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Explosions fire one by one as though shattering a spinal column, one disc at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sentinels react as the explosions erupt from the shaf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rock and earth bury the entrance,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 706 707 708 709 710 Wil 712 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thick cloud of earth is coughed from the opening near t top of Zion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rumble from the explosion slowly fades. Lock stares u the dark cave ceiling, talking to his enemy as one might to God.

dialogues.speaker: LOCK
dialogues.text: Your move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monstrous cables lay beneath us like giant black worm the Logos roars past us following the lines that stretch beyond the dark horizon.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 710
dialogues.text: OMITTED Fil

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: 2002 1O0A-101. 713 714 715 716  GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 102. 717 OMITTED Ty

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The council is crowded into the private quarters, questio the three Captains.  72i GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 103. 721

dialogues.speaker: DILLARD
dialogues.text: So you gave them your ship?

dialogues.speaker: NIOBE
dialogues.text: That is correct, councillor. I did.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Knowing what he planned to do with it? She nods.

dialogues.speaker: HAMMAN
dialogues.text: And the Oracle said nothing of this?

dialogues.speaker: NIOBE
dialogues.text: She told me that Neo would need my help and that when the time came, I would choose to help him or not.

dialogues.speaker: WEST
dialogues.text: But what hope can a single vessel have against their entire defense system? -

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: None. It’s completely impossible. But he wouldn't listen. He wouldn't even take any ammunition. He was totally out of his goddamn mind. Morpheus has sat as silent as a stoic until now.

dialogues.speaker: MORPHEUS
dialogues.text: No. The council turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: . MORPHEUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He was not. Neo is doing what he believes he must do. ° . What he says, he says as much for himself as for them.

dialogues.speaker: MORPHEUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t know if what he’s doing is right. I don’t know if he'll reach the Machine city and if he does, I don’t know what he can do to save us. But I do know that as long as there is a single breath in his body, he will never give up. He stands.  ey 722 723 724 725 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 104. 72h

dialogues.speaker: MORPHEUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And either can we.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large spool of black cable bangs against the metal floo a new line is uncoiled out from a large portable power supply. The control room is a frenzy as they work to bring the defense systems back online. Operations Officers Mattis and Wirtz study the hologram o the dock as a ring of Sentinels circle the silent digger.

dialogues.speaker: WIRTZ
dialogues.text: What are they doing?

dialogues.speaker: MATTIS
dialogues.text: I don’t know... Better get the Commander.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A single Sentinel has attached itself to the abdomen of t digger, tentacles and feelers merging with heavy machiner Ils red eyes Lhrob hypnotically as its brethren glide rit like around it in a steady inciting circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowd has now gathered around the screen, including Commander Lock. They watch as it floats above the digger.

dialogues.speaker: LOCK
dialogues.text: Goddamnit!

dialogues.speaker: MATTIS
dialogues.text: What are they doing?

dialogues.speaker: LOCK
dialogues.text: The same thing we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Electricity crackles from the Sentinel, wrapping the digg in a gossamer web of blue light. The flashing bolts light the dock like a giant arc welder. There is a small explosion inside the gut of the digger, burst of combustion as it is jolted back to life. And the Sentinel falls lifelessly to the dock floor,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 725 726 727 728 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 105. 725 Its enormous arms crank open, a crane unfolding as it beg to Lift itself. The grinders roar to life, getting up to speed before it lowers itself back down. immediately Sentinels swarm around it, gliding in tight circles; so many of them that it feels as though a wall w being built to protect it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rumble of the digger returning to its job shakes the room.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST OPERATOR
dialogues.text: What do we do now, Commander? Lock doesn’t have an answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neo looks out at the distant horizon that breaks against jagged edge of a mountain range. He is able to see a powerful source of light, glowing lik sun about to rise, hidden behind a horizon of seething darkness.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: There. Those mountains. That’s it.

dialogues.speaker: . TRINITY
dialogues.text: Do you see what's coming?

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: If you tell me we'ré going to make it, I'll believe you.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: We'll make it. He reaches out for her hand. She takes it.

dialogues.speaker: NEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We have to.  729 730 731 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 729 Through the window of the cockpit we see what‘’s coming; massive force of huge, heavy war Machines led by a swarm Sentinels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock addresses the Council and military heads.

dialogues.speaker: LOCK
dialogues.text: It is now a matter of time. The Machines will breach the walls of the city. I recommend the Council join the rest of the non-military personnel inside the Temple.

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: How long do we have?

dialogues.speaker: LOCK
dialogues.text: Two hours. Maybe less. The Council reacts with obvious dismay.

dialogues.speaker: LOCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My men have begun fortifying the entrance with enough artillery to make our last stand. Beyond that there isn’t anything more I can do.

dialogues.speaker: DILLARD
dialogues.text: Commander, do you think that we have a chance of surviving?

dialogues.speaker: LOCK
dialogues.text: If I were you, Conne me that question. I’ lor, I wouldn’t ask ilor, d ask one of them. He gestures towards Hamman and Morpheus.

dialogues.speaker: DILLARD
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: LOCK
dialogues.text: Because they’re the ones that believe in miracles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Logos flies into the jaws of the Armada, Machines rows of jagged shark-teeth. 731 forming  731 732 733 734 735 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 107. 731 They attack in a frenzy; red lasers stabbing into the Log as the larger armored crab-~like machines spit bolts of e that break against the hull sending a shiver of sizzling electricity through the entire ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trinity has to let go of the stick as hot arcing voltage surges through the controls. Neo clings to her hand as he wades into battle, hurling h mind at them with ballistic force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three spinning Sentinels release three tow-bombs that ope as they rocket towards the ship. Nec reacts quickly, exploding the first immediately, the second, just before it hits, the fire washing over the windshield as the Logos shoots through. But the third he grabs hold of, straining against its for and direction, bending it to his will as he once bent a spoon. The device sails up over the cockpit, before turning and hurtling back at the Machines. The Sentinels dodge out of the way, but the armored crustacean is too slow and-- The device slams into it, unleashing a violent orange rag destruction. The dog-fight continues as the Sentinels now reach the Lo leaping onto its back, sticking their lasers through its like toreadors thrusting swords into the back of a chargi bull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweat covers Neo’s body as he reacts more and more violen

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: There’s too many...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Sentinel dives like a kamikaze straight at the cockpit Neo reaches out to stop it--

dialogues.speaker: GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 108.
dialogues.text: 735 Wrestling with it. As its eyes begin to blink, it corkscr wildly out of control, slamming against the heavy plated glass which shatters, cratering under the Machine’s bulk We experience what Neo experiences; a meteor of light tha blasts through his body--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrenching free his grip from Trinity. His arm flails back as he feels himself disconnect, his m Flung loose until-- She snatches hold of him again,

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: ZT got you. His head swims as he drags himself back from the abyss.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on, Neo! I need help here! Ahead they are approaching a perfect line of fearsome floating Machines, each like an entire division of tanks welded into one.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: +.-left.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: Bank left. A tank fires just as Trinity banks left, a missile of ene chewing up the entire underbelly of the ship. Inside the cockpit several monitors explode and the main lights die.

dialogues.speaker: NEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: To can’t beat them.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: Go up. Over them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 736 737 738 739 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 109. 736

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: The sky. She looks at him

dialogues.speaker: NEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s the only way.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: Then up we go. She pounds on the pedal and outside the pads erupt, openi all the way as the ship tips--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocketing towards the churning black sky, leaving a white jet trail that cuts up from the black earth at a forty-fi degree angle. Several Sentinels leap from the back of the ship, but man remain as it barrels towards the dark roiling ceiling. The Logos plunges into the sky with a surreal splash, lik plane crashing into a sea of shaving cream. The molecular replicators immediately drain the life from Sentinels and they fall dead-- Tearing through the clouds that cling to them momentarily like shredded pieces of parachute, before letting them fa away. The Logos is engulfed by a ball of lightning as it is attacked by the sky. It shakes violently, every light blo out, until the ship dies--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drowning the cockpit with darkness, where we glimpse-~ Two hands still holding tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The forward momentum carries them just a little higher un suddenly there is a spectacular explosion of light as-- The ship breaks out the other side revealing a perfect bl sky lit by a brilliant yellow sun.  740 Al 742 743 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light washes over her face with a warmth she has neve known. It is a vision of the real world she has never see

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: -.-beautiful. EXT. BLUE SKY - DAY 74h The ship hits its apex, hangs then slowly twists, as it begins to fall, slipping quickly back into the billowing black silk of clouds. a Their stomachs pitch as the Logos is buffeted by storm an wind, spinning like a falling leaf until-- It splashes out of the clouds, revealing--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Machine City. To Trinity it looks like a massive mechanical coral reef, spreading as far as the eye can see. To Neo, it is another universe; a pinwheel nebula, spiral towards him, a billion pinpricks of light strung together swirling into clusters that blaze beneath a veil of glowi vapor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their fall accelerates, the city rushing towards them as Trinity again turns to Neo.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: Pump the ignitor. The ship will start. She grabs the lever and pumps. Tries the ignition. Nothin

dialogues.speaker: NEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Again. She does it again, pumping vigorously.

dialogues.speaker: NEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Slowly. Calmly, methodically, she pumps the lever while the architecture of the city gains dimension, its towers risi like fingers of a hand reaching up with a rushing force.  743 744 745 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 111. 743 Neo feels the energy in the ignition slowly building as a single tower now looms, filling the entire windscreen. Trinity closes her eyes, pumping vigilantly, until~-

dialogues.speaker: NEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now. She hits the ignition, opening her eyes to the tower that now a wall. The engine fires, the pads crackle with life and their fa slows, but not fast enough. EXT. MACHINE CITY TOWER -— NIGHT 744 The ship bores into the tower, plowing through the nano-b structure that is a surrealist re-combining of the organi and the mechanical; an anthill or wasps’ nest built from webwork of pipes, wires and silicon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The windshield explodes as Neo and Trinity are again torn apart. The ship merges violently with the tower, grinding a final wrenching stop. All becomes quiet. Cobwebs of shimmering light drape all around Neo as it ta him a moment to realize that he is in fact still alive.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: ..-Trin? There is no response.

dialogues.speaker: NEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: frinity? Trinity! Yanking his feet free from the crush of debris, he crawls the direction of her chair.

dialogues.speaker: NEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: trinity!

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: «+-I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: Where? She reaches her hand out to him.  GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 112.

dialogues.speaker: . TRINITY
dialogues.text: Here. With her touch comes a flood of relief.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: We made it.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: You said we would. He draws closer, feeling his way.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: I couldn’t have done it without you.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: ---T know. He smiles; unable to see her, he looks at the gossamer threads of light surrounding them.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: It’s unbelievable, Trin. Light everywhere. Like the whole thing was built of light. I wish you could see what I see. We see her face for the first time and we see that she is erying.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: You've already shown me so much. He knows something is wrong.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: What is it? Trinity? What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: T can’t go with you, Neo. I’ve gone as far as I can.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: What... He reaches for her and immediately feels the wet warmth o her blood soaking through her shirt.

dialogues.speaker: NEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh no, no, no.  GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 113. 745

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long shafts of metal are driven through her body like nee pinning a butterfly in place.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: It’s all right, Neo. It’s time. I’ve done what I can do. Now you have to do the rest.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: You have to. You have to finish it. You have to save Zion.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: I can’t...not without you.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: You can. You will. I believe it. I always have. Tears leak from his bandages.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: Trinity, you can’t die. You can’t!

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: Yes, I can. You brought me back once. But not this time. He doesn’t want to believe it.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you remember on that roof, after you caught me? The last thing I said to you?

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: You said, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY
dialogues.text: I wish I hadn’t. That was my last thought. I wished that I had one more chance to say what mattered... He feels her tears on his fingertips.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: To say how much I loved you, how grateful I was for every moment I was with you, but by the time I knew how to say what I wanted, it was too late.  745 746 747 748 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 114. 745 She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But you brought me back. You gave me my wish; one more chance. To say what I really wanted to say... For the last time she reaches up and touches his face.

dialogues.speaker: TRINITY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kiss me...once more...kiss me... He lowers his lips to hers and it ends as it began-- With a kiss. He feels her last breath on his lips and he weeps, holdin the hand that can no longer hold him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rumbling of the digger shakes all of Zion. The Temple congested with panicked chaos. Near the entrance, Lock is organizing the defense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire tower is quivering as the wall begins to crack The wall splits, giving birth to a ball of metal teeth spitting rock and dust. The digger chews through, rending rock, shredding steel and shaking the entire city. Tt emerges with a final rearing thrust, then tips free an falis-- Smashing through the lacework of catwalks, before crashin into the knotted tangle of pipe at the base of Zion, bury into the bedrock and metal like a knife to its hilt. The black hole breathes brimstone as a cloud of dust sett over Zion like a shroud. INT. ZION - TEMPLE — NIGHT 748 People cling to each other as the booming crash echoes through their bodies. Link holds Zee and looking up at the dark ceiling of the Temple, he whispers.  748 749 750 751 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 115. 748

dialogues.speaker: LINK
dialogues.text: Neo... You gonna do something, you better do it quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neo climbs. Feeling his way, rising from the wreckage alo the coiled mechanical intestines. There are sounds all around him: a ratcheting clatter tha rises and fades like a rattlesnake warning, the hiss of a radiator pipe, the scrape of a rake dragged against concr The sounds circle as if patiently watching him like vultu watching a dying man. He heaves himself up into a large passageway running horizontally through the tower.,It spirals, coiling inwar woven out of shiny metal rods that are ribbed and knuckle like bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Neo stands, we experience the passage as he does; a tu of light, its surface as perfectly smooth as a mirror. He steps forward and a ripple spreads out from his foot a though he were walking on water that had been rolled into tube. At the end of the passage there is an opening that window out ef the tower. Neo moves towards it, until he stands o the edge, awed by what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees the Machine city, an endless sprawling metropolis built out of pure energy. Towers of glowing spun glass ri up from crystalline structures of radiant light. Everywhere, hovering like hummingbirds, are creatures seemingly created out of fibers of light, soldered into patterns of a three dimensional circuit board. There is a celestial and even spiritual quality to the im until we reveal the city-in-itself-- A dark industrial nightmare. Underlit by angry bursts of lightning. Demons of black steel and chrome hang everywhe “orawling along the walls, the springs in their limbs tightening like a rat trap being loaded-— While thousands of blood-red eyes bore into Neo.  751 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 116. 751 Suddenly those closest to him, scatter, leaping from the walls, flying away, clearing, as small fish run from the approach of a much bigger fish. From below, an enormous and complex Machine rises to face Neo. It is so large that it eclipses the entire city. Neo steadies himself, overwhelmed momentarily by its powe and brilliance. The Deus ex Machina unleashes a locust swarm of tiny mach that seem ready to envelop Neo.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: i only ask to say what IT have come to say. After that, do what you want and fT won't try to stop you. The locust swarm swirls back creating an undulating ball mechanical bugs that remain in constant motion. Neo experiences the Deus ex Machina as a huge ball of ene like a sun, its face in constant flux. The bugs coalesce and an almost human face pushes itself from underneath.

dialogues.speaker: SPEAK
dialogues.text: The voice has a synthesized quality, resonating with a se that it is not one voice, but every voice.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: The program called Smith has grown beyond your control. The face disappears as quickly as it appeared.

dialogues.speaker: NEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Soon he will spread through this city as he spread through the Matrix. The locusts begin vibrating, chittering and trembling lik animals sensing a storm.

dialogues.speaker: NEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You cannot stop him. But IT can. Rage explodes from the face, spitting bugs at Neo as it screams.  751 752 753 754 755 756 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 117. 751

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: If that’s true, then I’ve made a mistake and you should kili me now. The face fades, the storm circling Neo for a moment befor slowly collecting itself as the face re-emerges.

dialogues.speaker: WHAT DO YOU WANT
dialogues.text: Neo looks up into the blinding brightness.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: Peace. ‘INT. ZION — TEMPLE ENTRANCE - NIGHT 752 The Sentinel army pours from the dark gaping mouth floodi the entire city.

dialogues.text: Thé kid swallows hard, wiping the sweat from his palms as steadies the grip on his gun. INT. ZION —- TEMPLE ENTRANCE - NIGHT 754 The leading force descends to the Temple entrance, limbs outstretched like the talons of an attacking bird of prey The first Sentinel slams down onto the metal bridge, rear back on its haunches as its brethren smack down behind hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every gun is clutched like a talisman as the Sentinel pee into the cave.

dialogues.text: Suddenly, a circling Sentinel jerks upward, its communica dish snapping open. It raises it as if trying to hear something. The message spreads quickly as the clicking dishes fan op in every Sentinel. The lead Sentinel backs up.  757 758 759 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 118.

dialogues.text: What are they doing? Morpheus isn't sure. INT. MACHINE CITY TOWER -— NIGHT 758 The entire passageway comes alive around Neo as cables an metal rods grow like a time-lapsed plant, forming a seat under him and filling every jack. A cobra-like cable rises up to the back of Neo'’s neck pausing, its needle probing at the brain-jack.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: IT won't. The face almost smiles as it fades away. The cable thrusts into Neo, plunging the pistol-needle in his brain, plugging his consciousness into the Matrix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morpheus sets his gun down and stands up.

dialogues.speaker: NIOBE
dialogues.text: What are you doing? He steps over the barricade and walks wy entrance.

dialogues.speaker: LOCK
dialogues.text: Morpheus! Lock signals to several soldiers to cover him. The kid lurches out just behind Niobe. Morpheus stops at the edge of the pool of water. Outside Temple, he can see the Sentinels gliding in slow patterns Three Sentinels lay just outside the opening like sleepin lions. One of the soldiers raises his gun and a Sentinel leaps t its feet with the sound of a dozen machine guns being coc  759 760 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 i119. 759

dialogues.speaker: MORPHEUS
dialogues.text: No! The soldier drops his gun and slowly the Sentinel lowers down.

dialogues.speaker: NIOBE
dialogues.text: Neo. Morpheus nods.

dialogues.speaker: MORPHEUS
dialogues.text: He fights for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sick green-black sky vomits a raging storm upon the urb night-scape below. Lightning spits from every cloud like constant flicker of snake tongues. Black boots stride down the center of the rain soaked str We follow as Neo walks, glancing left, then right at a ci of Agent Smiths. They line the streets, their perfect silhouettes filling the windows of skyscrapers. It is a c of dark-suited, sunglass-wearing shadows. Lightning flash-bulbs a group of them, staring at Neo, smiling identically. A singular Smith enters the street and turns towards Neo, walking at him until they stand, like gun fighters-- Face to face.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Mr. Anderson. Welcome back. We missed you. Rain pours off his face as lightning pitch-~forks the sky behind him.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Like what I’ve done with the place? Another bolt strikes, this time in front of him, so we se reflected in his sunglasses.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: It ends tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 760 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 120. 760

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: I know it does. I’ve seen it. That’s why the rest of me is just going to enjoy the show. We already know that I'm the cone that beats you.

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: The only place you can beat me, Smith-~ He snaps open his coat, his body automatically settling i a defensive position.

dialogues.speaker: NEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is in your dreams. Smith’s smile twists into a sneer and he hurls himself at enemy. The first exchange is a squall, fast and furious, as lightning strobes the water exploding with every blow. They mirror one another, neither one gaining or losing gr until each sees the exact same opening-~- Simultaneously delivering a thunder packed punch that sen both men flying backwards-—- Neo flips and lands gracefully, while Smith smashes down, concrete buckling beneath him. Smith growls, cocking and loading himself, then firing ou hurtling up through the driving rain as-- Neo leaps to meet him and they collide high above the str Two egual and opposite forces slamming together like atom smashing as an expanding sphere of energy is unleashed fr the collision-- A globe of glass clearing away the rain swelling until it breaks open against the surrounding urban cliffs. The two men remain suspended in mid-air, battling, fists feet thrown with particle-accelerator speed. Neo fights with ultimate precision, but Smith has become overwhelmingly powerful. A blow snaps Neo’s head back, sending his glasses flying and before he recovers-- Smith grabs him, spinning like a decathlete in the hammer toss, and releases~-— Hurling Neo into the side of a building.  760 761 762 GOLDENROD REVISICNS JUNE 27, 2002 121. 760 He smashes into the building like a bullet, another seism wave of damage shattering the face of the building, follo the initial impact, the way thunder follows lightning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking back through the bored opening his body just crea Neo barely has time to stand before Smith barrels into hi The battle rages through the building, Smith pummeling Ne with wrecking ball force--~ Smashing him through walls of concrete, brick and steel. Smith steps through one of the holes as Neo struggles to back on his feet.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Can you feel it, Mr. Anderson? Closing in on you once more? I can. Once more, Neo picks himself up.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I really should thank you for it. After all, it was your life that taught me the purpose of all life. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The purpose of life is to end. Neo settles into a pose we have seen before. He signals t Smith, “come get some.” Nothing frustrates Smith as much as that little wave. Another fury roars through the building, but this one end with Neo unloading an explosion of kicks culminating in-~ Bullet Time; a final boot launched like a LAS rocket, blasting Smith--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the building, sailing back through the sheets of r until he slows regaining control. He looks back at the opening in the building where- Neo stands, lit by flashing lightning.  oot 763 764 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 122. 762 Smith grinds his teeth and launches himself back at him w Neo dives into the open air and-- Again they fly at each other, the impact of this collisio much more powerful than the first as-- Waves of force shatter windows and rip lamp posts from th concrete like a hurricane uprooting trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They fight in mid-air, punching, kicking, grappling, lock together but in constant motion like electrons chasing ea other around a single nucleus~- Oblivious to the height, they rise up beyond the city’s g towers until they are amidst the flashing electric tongue lightning and the city is a distant pattern of light bene them. Smith lands a series of savage blows that stun Neo and he slips down, twisting, lost for a moment, suddenly vulnera Above him, Smith rises up just as twin bolts of lightning strike, haloing the dark-suited demon with jagged broken of light. - With the crashing din of thunder that follows, Smith atta Diving down, he slams into Neo, tackling him, driving him back to the earth-- Streaking like a comet, faster than the rain, plummeting the mirrored towers as Neo struggles to get free, fightin even as the inevitability of the ground rushes towards th and-~ The unstoppable force meets the immovable object.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The concussive blast craters the street, buckling buildin as a wave of unequaled destruction rushes out over the ur chasm. The explosion thunders away until there is only the hissi rain, as the Smiths gather along the crater’s edge. Inside the bowl of earth is the exposed viscera of the metropolis; broken pipes, sparking cables and rent sewers The rain on his face slowly brings Neo’s consciousness ba  764 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 123. 764 Smith stands over him as he tries to get up.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Why, Mr. Anderson? it is an effort to even pull his arm from the wet sucking mud. .

dialogues.speaker: SMITH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why do you do it? Why get up? Why keep fighting? Neo rolls over, pushing himself to his hands and knees.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you believe you’re fighting for something? For more than your survival? Can you tell me what: it is? Do you even know? Neo glares at him with animal-like eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is it freedom? Or truth? Perhaps peace? Yes? No? Could it be for love? He laughs.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tllusions, Mr. Anderson. Vagaries of perception. The temporary constructs of a feeble human intellect trying desperately to justify an existence that is without meaning or purpose. Neo’s hands clench into fists.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And all of them as artificial as the Matrix itself, although only a human mind could invent something as insipid as love. Rain streaks the mud down Neo’s face like black tears.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You must be able to see it, Mr. Anderson. You must know it by now. You can’t win. It's pointless to keep fighting. Neo summons his strength and once more, he stands.  ~a a be GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 124. 764

dialogues.speaker: SMITH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why, Mr. Anderson? Why? Why do you persist?!

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: Because I choose to. Smith howls in frustration, hurling at him, but Nec absor the attack, catching Smith momentarily off-balance-~ Firing back a furious attack that has Smith reeling, unab to defend himself as Neo loads up a bomb. It is not a pun it is a cannonball-- Shot into Bullet Time; his fist shattering through the gl like rods of rain as it hurls at Smith-~ Connecting flush, distorting his features as the flesh of face is knocked loose and his eyes go blank. He staggers, stunned, out on his feet as Neo hauls back a gathers the Tai-chi ball, summoning every last bit of his energy, his life-force, then-- Slams it into Smith, catapulting him into the wall of the crater-~ Burying him from sight. Neo sways in the rain with barely enough strength to stan the army of Smiths look down from the crater edge. A low ominous rumble begins to shake the earth. Neo drops head unable to watch as the rumble rises until-- The wall of the crater explodes like an exit wound, earth asphalt shot-gunning out, es Smith bursts from

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs in the air, his mud-covered face distorted with rage.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: This is my world! My world! He dives into Neo who has nothing left and batters him, e bludgeoning blow striking in time with searing bolts of lightning. He seizes Neo by the throat, hoisting him up like a rag d and fires a super~punch that sends Neo flying-- Bouncing down to the earth like a crashing airplane, trenching to a stop.  764 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 125. 764 Smith is about to press his frenzied assault, but he free the image of Neo laying splayed, suddeniy familiar.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait... I’ve seen this... This is it! This is the end! He looks at Neo and in a flash of lightning we see the immediate future as Smith stabs his entire fist into Neo’ chest. Smith blinks away the raindrops blurring his vision.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yes, you were laying right there, just like that... And IT... Another flash and we see the black mirror begin to cover WNeo’s body. Smith walks over to Neo who is desperately clinging to hi consciousness as if hanging from the edge of a precipice.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I stand here, right here and I'm supposed to say something... I say... Again the future flashes in his eyes and he sees Neo’s ha buried beneath the gleaming blackness.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Everything that has a beginning, has an end. The familiar words suddenly clear Neo’s mind. He looks up Smith looks down.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Den’t be afraid, Neo. Neo almost can‘t believe what he just heard as-- Another flash reveals the liquid obsidian covering Neo’s face, but his face is calm, even serene.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? What did I just say? In his confusion, he looks to Neo who now understands.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, no. This isn’t right. This can’t be right!  GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 126. 764 One final time, Neo rises to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get away from me!

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: What are you afraid of?

dialogues.speaker: SMITE
dialogues.text: It’s a trick!

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: No, it’s what you want. It’s why you’re here.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: NEO
dialogues.text: You were right, Smith. You were always right. Rain pours down Smith’s tortured face.

dialogues.speaker: NEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It was inevitable. Smith’s eyes fire, a scream rises up from him and in a crackling, blinding flash of lightning-- He stabs his fist into Neo, who stands with his arms open accepting the blow. Exactly as in the flashing visions, Neo is covered by the darkness. Rising up over his face, Neo closes his eyes an lost beneath the liquid shroud. The whole sky continues to weep as Smith enters him, possessing him, as the darkness snaps into a perfect pair sunglasses. The mud covered Smith backs away from the new Smith as if trusting him.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Is it over? The new Smith nods his head once and the old Smith smiles And as a giddiness spreads through him, he starts to laug

dialogues.text: INT. MACHINE CITY TOWER — NIGHT 765 Neo'’s body hangs motionless, supported by the passageway we see as Neo would, an empty husk that is being filled, liguid light pouring into him from every connection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old Smith realizes that he is laughing alone. There i something wrong with the new Smith. The new Smith begins to tremble, a shiver that grows into convulsion.

dialogues.speaker: OLD SMITH
dialogues.text: Oh no, no, no. It’s not fairl It’s not fair!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neo’s body arches, his arms pinned wide as he tries to sc but instead of sound, a shaft of light beams out. He opens his eyes and light pours out of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light brightens around Smith's sunglasses, until they beg to crack and shred like wet tissues as shafts of brillian light burst free. Now the old Smith begins to feel it as his body begins to shiver uncontrollably.

dialogues.speaker: OLD SMITH
dialogues.text: No! The new Smith continues to crack open, light beaming out his distended and deteriorating form, filling the entire crater as-— One by one it spreads through to all the Smiths. Shafts of light burst from the shells of Smith like water breaking through a dam, dissolving away each dark silhone Until there are hundreds of faceless forms all made out o bright radiant light. The old Smith, at the center of the crater, fights to the last. His scream rails against the buildings as he bursts open and is consumed by light.  768 769 770 Wi 772 773 <a

dialogues.text: 768 Ht nm GO. sD te
