MACHINE CITY TOWER — NIGET 769 A final surge rushes through Neo, his body convulsing aga his metal coils and we see the light drain out of him, as life slowly leaves him and his body falls quiet and still Neo dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the center of the crater lies the body of the Oracle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cables and rods lower Neo's lifeless body, as it is l onto the floor of the mechanical cave. The face of the Deus ex Machina gazes once more upon him.

dialogues.speaker: DEUS EX MACHINA
dialogues.text: It is done. The face recedes and the enormous Machine sinks away like setting sun.

dialogues.speaker: Q
dialogues.text: fa ch A hovering Sentinel closes its dish, turns and rises up of the hole made by the digger. One by one the other Sentinels follow. No one can believe what they are seeing. Leck stands alone clutching his gun.

dialogues.speaker: LOCK
dialogues.text: it doesn't make sense. Morpheus walks across the stream and stands at the door o the Temple looking up at what is without question a mirac the entire Sentinel army leaving Zion.

dialogues.speaker: MORPHEUS
dialogues.text: He did it.  773 774 775 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 129. 773 The others move in behind him, their faces staring up in

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: He saved us. He saved us. The last of the Machines glide out of sight and waves of emotion sweep through all of them. The kid can’t hold it in and he screams, joy bursting out hin.

dialogues.speaker: KID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He did it! It's over! He did it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His voice spills out into the Temple as he follows, almos falling, caught by several soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: HAMMAN
dialogues.text: What is it? What‘’s happened?

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: Sir, Councilor, he did it, sir! Neo did it!

dialogues.speaker: HAMMAN
dialogues.text: Did what?

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: He ended the war! The Sentinels are gone! It's over, sir! The war is over! Hamman is unable to breathe as he drinks down the information. The kid turns and leaps onto a boulder, his voice filling the Temple.

dialogues.speaker: KID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Zion! It’s over! The war is over! Tears stream down both Link and Zee’s faces as they embra A huge resounding cheer surges up from the people of Zion they break open with relief and joy. INT. ZION - TEMPLE ENTRANCE ~— NIGHT 775 Morpheus and Niobe hear the cheering that rolls up out of Temple. Morpheus unable to move, unable to embrace a moment he wa his entire life for.  775 776

dialogues.speaker: MORPHEUS
dialogues.text: I've imagined this moment for so long... He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: MORPHEUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is it real? She nods and he reaches out to her, trying to feel someth to make him believe it and-- Finding it in her arms. Niobe looks up with tears brimming in her bright eyes.

dialogues.speaker: NIOBE
dialogues.text: Wherever you are, Neo, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neo’s body is dragged from the passageway by a Machine th looks like a sawed-open garbage truck. The Machine quietly and efficiently drops him onto the op bed, then turns, gliding away as a barge might drift out sea. We see the Machine City once more as Neo did; dazzling erystalline structures of light and at the center, bearin away the body of Neo, a being that appears like an angel from the morning sun as it glitters against the wide open ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain pebbles the angelic face of Sati as a black cat carefully pads up next to her and licks her cheek. In a blink the cat disappears and as it does-- It stops raining. The cracked and broken ground is now replaced with a perfectly smooth sidewalk. Sati remains in the in the same sleeping position as the again softly pads in and licks her cheek, exactly as it j did. Sati slowly wakes up and smiles at the cat.

dialogues.speaker: SATI
dialogues.text: Good morning.  777 778 GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 131. 777 The cat purrs, nudging against her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it morning? She yawns and lifts herself up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of expensive black loafers stride down the street. The black shoes stop as the man finds what he was looking sitting on a park bench. The Oracle smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: ORACLE
dialogues.text: Well, now ain’t this a surprise. The Architect hides his sneer in the corners of his mouth

dialogues.speaker: ARCHITECT
dialogues.text: You played a very dangerous game.

dialogues.speaker: ORACLE
dialogues.text: Change always is.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHITECT
dialogues.text: If it were up to me, it wouldn’t have ended this way.

dialogues.speaker: ORACLE
dialogues.text: Then I’m grateful it wasn’t up to you.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHITECT
dialogues.text: Just how long do you think this peace is going to last?

dialogues.speaker: ORACLE
dialogues.text: As long as it can. She smiles and he decides to leave.

dialogues.speaker: ORACLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What about the others?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHITECT
dialogues.text: What others?

dialogues.speaker: ORACLE
dialogues.text: The ones that want out.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHITECT
dialogues.text: Obviously, they will be freed.

dialogues.speaker: ORACLE
dialogues.text: I have your word? He glances back, insulted.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHITECT
dialogues.text: What do you think I am? Human? He smiles and walks away as Sati yells.

dialogues.speaker: SATII
dialogues.text: Oracle! Carrying the cat, she leads Seraph over the hill to the bench, bolting to the Oracle,

dialogues.speaker: SATI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We were afraid we might not find you.

dialogues.speaker: ORACLE
dialogues.text: Everything’s okay now.

dialogues.speaker: SERAPH
dialogues.text: It’s good Lo see you again.

dialogues.speaker: ORACLE
dialogues.text: It’s always good to see you.

dialogues.speaker: SATI
dialogues.text: Look! Look! She points to an unbelievably beautiful sunrise, rays of 132. 778 extraordinarily vibrant colors streaked across the sky wi the joy and ardor of a child’s finger-painting.

dialogues.speaker: ORACLE
dialogues.text: dust look at that. Beautiful. Did you do that? Sati beams, as she nods her head.

dialogues.speaker: SATI
dialogues.text: For Neo.

dialogues.speaker: ORACLE
dialogues.text: That's nice. I know he’d love it.

dialogues.speaker: SATI
dialogues.text: Will we ever see him again?  GOLDENROD REVISIONS JUNE 27, 2002 133.

dialogues.speaker: ORACLE
dialogues.text: I suspect so. Someday. She stands up.

dialogues.speaker: ORACLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now I don’t know about you two, but I sure would Like something to eat. Something sweet.

dialogues.speaker: SATI
dialogues.text: Me too! Seraph turns to the Oracle.

dialogues.speaker: SERAPH
dialogues.text: Bid you always know?

dialogues.speaker: ORACLE
dialogues.text: Oh no. No I didn't. But I believed. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ORACLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I believed. They head to their home, walking into the sunrise as-- Young dawn raises her rose-red fingers. Fade out.
